data.title: Athletes Who Died on June 6
data.meta_description: Famous deaths in sport for the 6th of June. See which famous players, sports stars, managers and coaches died on June 6.
data.text:
Charley Jones, American MLB Baseball outfielder, and one of the first sluggers, 1875-88 (Cincinnati Reds; Boston Red Caps, and 3 other teams), dies at 59

Louis Chevrolet

Swiss auto racer and co-founder of Chevrolet Motor Car Company, dies of a heart attack at 62

Norman Reid, cricketer (Test S Af v Aust 1921-22, 11 & 6, 2-63), dies

Lionel Hallam, English cricket batsman and captain (9 Tests, 4 x 50; Hampshire CCC) and politician (Member House of Lords, Lord Temporal 1928â€“51), dies at 61

Janina Spychajowa-Kurkowska, Polish archer (record 5x women's world championships), dies at 78

Bill Voce, English cricket fast bowler (27 Tests, 98 wickets, BB 7/70; Nottinghamshire CCC), dies at 74

Manfred Stengl, Austrian luger (Olympic gold men's doubles 1964), dies in a motorcycle accident at 46

Kusuo Kitamura, Japanese 1500m freestyle swimmer (Olympic gold 1932), dies at 78

Eddie Stanky, American baseball 2nd baseman (MLB All Star 1947, 48, 50; Brooklyn Dodgers, Boston Braves, NY Giants) and manager (St. Louis Cardinals, Chicago White Sox, Texas Rangers), dies of a heart attack at 83

Vladimir Krutov, Russian ice hockey forward (Canada Cup 1981; Olympic gold 1984, 88; World C'ship gold 1981, 82, 83, 86, 89; Vancouver Canucks 1989-90), dies from liver failure at 52

Esther Williams, American swimmer and actress (Dangerous When Wet), dies from natural causes at 91

Viktor Korchnoi, Russian-born chess grandmaster, dies at 85

Red Schoendienst, American Baseball HOF second baseman, manager, coach (10 x MLB All Star; 5 x World Series St. Louis Cardinals, Milwaukee Braves), dies at 95

Eric Nesterenko, Canadian ice hockey center (NHL All Star 1961, 65; Toronto Maple Leafs; Stanley Cup 1961 Chicago Black Hawks), dies at 88

Gints Freimanis, Latvian soccer right-back (13 caps; Jelgava 110 games), dies from skin cancer at 38

2023 Pat Casey, American BMX rider (World C'ship gold Freestyle park BMX 2011; X Games gold dirt, BMX park 2021), dies in a motocross practice accident at 29

2023 Teddy McCarthy, Irish hurler (2 x All-Ireland Titles; Cork; Sarsfields GAA) and Gaelic footballer (2 x All-Ireland Titles; Cork; Glanmire GFC), dies at 57
